description: Generic listing of all variables. Should not be used directly, please use Variables or RepeatedVariables instead
table this variable is part of
name of the variable, unique within a table
in case of protocolised data collection this defines the moment in time this variable is collected on
Definition of a table within a data release
unique name in the release
short human readible description
description of the role/function of this table
defines what each record in this table describes
count of the number of records in this table
Definition of a non-repeated variable, or of the first variable from a repeated range
string,int,decimal,date,datetime etc
unit ontology
to sort variables you can optionally add an order value
whether this variable is required within this collection
listing of all repeated variables defined for this variable
Definition of a repeated variable. Refers to another variable for its definition.
reference to the definition of the variable that is being repeated
Listing of categorical value+label definition in case of a categorical variable
e.g. PATO
reference to ontology term that defines this categorical value
Mapping from collected tables to standard/harmonized tables, optionally including ETL syntaxes
name of the table being mapped from
name of the common data model being mapped to
name of the table being mapped to
Order in which table ETLs should be executed for this source-target combination
human readible description of the mapping
formal definition of the mapping, ideally executable code
Mappings from collected variables to standard/harmonized variables, optionally including ETL syntax.
Source variable(s) to map from.
Target variable to map to.
e.g. 'complete, partial, planned, no-match'
human readible description of the mapping
additional notes and comments
formal definition of the mapping, ideally executable code
Definition of an action of data collection for a resource
Age groups included, if applicable
number of participants sampled in this event
(sub)populations that are targeted with this collection event
Subpopulations defined in this resource
e.g. 'Mothers in first trimester','newborns'
